characters: DREW'S RUNNING RIGHT AT THEM DOWN THE SIDEWALK WITH THE
CODED AND ACCOUNTED FOR RIGHT UP TO...
BUT SHE KNOWS THE DETECTIVE'S EYES ARE ON THE BACK OF HER
AREN'T YOU TRYING TO FIND HIM
STILL HUGGING THE EMPEROR IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PACK, ALL
POOR NAKED DREW FREEZES. THE WORLD STOPS SPINNING ON ITS
THEY CATCH UP TO HER IN A SWARM, KNOCKING HER ONTO THE
CAP FALLING OFF AND THE STICKY, CHERRY RED MESS FANNING
... A GIANT PACK OF PEDIGREED POOCHES WHO CHASE DREW
THE PAGE, WHERE EVERY FIFTEEN MINUTES IS COLOR-
... A TV TUNED TO "THE TODAY SHOW" WHERE WHACK
PASSES WILLIAMSON AND THE U.N. SECURITY GUY IN THE
HOTEL SECURITY ON OUR TAIL. COULD USE A HIDEOUT.
THE PLAZA WITH PARKER PULLING HER THROUGH.
THEM BOTH INTO THE LINE OF AUDIENCE MEMBERS, WHO THEN
OF WHOM GLEEFULLY LICK HER FACE
CLERK DROPS DREW LIKE A SAPP-SACKING GANNON, THROWING
NAME'S WARREN COLLIER. IF YOU'RE EVER IN THE CITY, I'D
HEAD AND SO SHE CLEARS HER THROAT AND
SIDEWALK OUTSIDE WHERE SHE DISAPPEARS UNDERNEATH A
SHE BUMPS HEAD-ON INTO BIKE MESSENGER/PRE-MED/MOUNTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the anxious, sweating, frightened face of DREW MacLEOD, 17, running to save her life. Think Dustin Hoffman in Marathon Man -- someone, something -- is after her but UNSEEN. She glances fearfully behind at her mysterious pursuer, her BREATHING becoming more labored. Cutting through a deserted park, she leaps a bench. Above her, the thin morning sun has only begun to lighten the leaves. Around the corner, she's back on a sidewalk lined with beautiful homes, all quiet at dawn, the only noise her racing FOOTSTEPS and quickening BREATHS.

dialogues.speaker: HER OWN FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: and safety loom half a block down. She pours on the effort, hurdles a hedge, jumps the stairs and makes the door, rips it open, bolts inside and SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHRUB
dialogues.text: where, with the CAMERA AT GROUND LEVEL, a GOLDEN RETRIEVER PUPPY, unable to leap the hedge, PLOWS INTO IT HEADFIRST and disappears. YELP! INT. MacLEOD HOUSE - FOYER - CONTINUOUS ACTION Drew, wheezing from the exertion, pulls an ASTHMA INHALER from her pocket, takes a hit, then peeks out the window in the front door and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The puppy squeezes through the hedge, wiggling its bum to extricate itself. A SIX-YEAR-OLD GIRL picks it up, hugs it close:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Jelly Bean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MacLEOD HOUSE - PARKER'S ROOM - MORNING CLOSE ON A JAPANESE EXECUTIVE (with a CLOCK in his belly) which suddenly begins SCREAMING IN JAPANESE, ITS JAW WAGGING. From under piles of clothes and sheets, PARKER MacLEOD, 17, Drew's twin sister, opens one eye, shuts OFF the shrieking ALARM CLOCK. With a SIGH, she throws her feet  over the edge of the bed. Her room is a train wreck.    Grabbing a MatchBox 20 T-shirt from the pile on the bed,  she gives it a sniff. Good enough. Pulling it on, she   pauses, looks a bit concerned down at her navel. A recent belly-button piercing looks a little red. She touches it. Ouch. When a RINGING is heard, she begins tossing clothes, blankets, shoes, trying to unearth the source. She pulls her BLACKBERRY from under the covers: THOREAU 786:   MADE CRITICAL ERROR LAST P.M. Parker snickers, types her return from...

dialogues.speaker: COURSE AROUND 3
dialogues.text: This makes her smile. NOTATWIN:   A CAREER MAN.   I LIKE THAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MacLEOD HOUSE - BATHROOM - MORNING Drew stands before the mirror, perfecting perfection. In a tasteful suit, hair just so, she opens the drawer... ... which is hyper-organized, everything in a little labeled nook. She pulls out tweezers and we see beneath where it says, "tweezers." She leans into the mirror very close, spots a stray eyebrow hair, plucks it. Pulling back, she raises her other eyebrow. Huh. Now they're not even.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She leans in again and plucks one from the other eyebrow. Uh-oh. This is like when your mom cuts your hair and keeps cutting to get it even until you're shaved. She reaches for the other side... but suddenly catches herself and stops. Deep breath. Let's not get too psychotic. She dunks the tweezers in the alcohol jar, then replaces them. Checking her teeth, she spots a stuck bit.       Grabbing WATER PICK she begins cleaning her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Startled, Drew shoots herself in the eye with the water pick. Parker's ENTERED from her side. Drew shuts off the water pick, dries her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the young executive look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my interview at NYU today. Parker, sleepy, stretches, unaware she's exposing her new belly ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way Mom knows about that. Self-consciously, Parker drops her arms, pulls her shirt down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she never will. At least until after I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell. Drew shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piercings are so... unhygienic. A little BEEP BEEP from her preset WATCH ALARM goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast. Drew turns on her heel and EXITS. When Parker sets her Blackberry down we get our first glimpse of... ... HER SIDE OF THE    BATHROOM which resembles a post- apocalyptic toiletry    landscape. There's a very clear line of demarcation    on the counter like the demilitari zone separating the    Koreas. Parker reaches among the rubble for her toothbrush but notices another message on her Blackberry:

dialogues.speaker: LOVE TO MEET. GOTTA GO.
dialogues.text: Accompanying the text, a PICTURE Warren has sent finishes downloading -- eighteenish, the shaggy chic, Calvin Klein model-type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly wide-awake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooo, Warren. Distracted, Parker drops her toothbrush, which bounces off the counter and PLOPS into the toilet. ON THE TOILET BOWL -- there it is, slowly sinking. Parker is stone-faced. She looks to her sister's side of the counter where a fresh brush sits in the flowered holder. She's considering... she's reaching... then... nah. Instead, she squeezes the tube straight into her mouth, brushes with a finger and spits. INT. MacLEOD HOUSE - KITCHEN - MORNING Drew's seated, napkin on lap, eating granola and studying her open DAYBOOK.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DR. QUINN MacLEOD, dressed professionally and obviously together even at this hour, pours coffee for herself and her husband, PROFESSOR CHARLEY MacLEOD, who ENTERS still in his ratty old bathrobe and outrageous bed-head. As a matter of routine, Quinn holds out his cup and he takes it, kisses her and sits down to the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the book coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sweety, my writing process is a lot like a giant hydroelectric dam. For a long time I just let the great ideas build up and build up until the sheer weight of them spills over and the words just come pouring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still stuck, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word. Parker ENTERS with her Blackberry in hand, smooches her pop, then takes a sat. Parker's clearly a chip off her Dad's block. Both pour milk first into their bowl, then Charley drops in Super Sugar Crisp while Parker pours in Count Chocula. Both hit 'em with a couple of spoons of extra sugar. Mom takes a seat, too, primly eating a piece of dry wheat toast that she slices in half first. Like Mom, like Drew. Drew spots the BLACKBERRY JPEG of Warren before Parker can turn it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one for the trophy room, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys can be fun. You should try one some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready for your interview?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (funny you should ask)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've prepared a color-coded itinerary based on dividing the day into fifteen minute increments alternating blue/red, double- checked the train schedule, confirmed with the Weather Channel and rehearsed a couple of alternate scenarios last night, you know, just to account for all the possible glitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take that as a yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you for sticking to your plan all these years, sweety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand why you want to finish college in two years? What's the big hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to hit the ground running. All those football games and the partying and the whole dating scene. It just seems like a lot of wasted time that could be spent more productively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accelerated program would look great on your med school application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football games I get. But partying? A waste of time? Parker looks to her dad.     He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To each her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Drew.   I have a surprise. Everybody stops what they're doing for a BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the day off. (excitedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going into the City with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- ?! Drew CHOKES on her granola and a little milk trickles out her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that great! We can do some shopping, have lunch, real girl stuff. Won't that be fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to have fun, I'm the one who should go, not Mother Teresa over there. Drew is still choking -- pretty badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know if you want me to do the Heimlich. It'd be cool to have you owe me your life. WHOOSH!   The granola goes down and she sucks air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still clearing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I mean, it's... impossible. I've got every minute accounted for right up to the interview. Blue and red! It won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought... you know... I've been working and we haven't had a chance to spend much time together...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quinn, the normally thick-skinned M.D., is tearing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and both my babies are going away to college next Fall. She takes her plate and goes to the sink and Parker follows her, putting an arm around her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sad, Mom. Just think, when Drew leaves for school, you won't be losing a daughter, you'll be losing an anal-retentive social misfit who will be voted most likely to die a virgin. Drew throws an arm around Quinn's other shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mom. It's really sweet of you. But don't worry. Parker will be living here with you forever since no college on earth will ever take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, you two. Mom blows her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fair you guys get to go into the City and I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have a chem test, young lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemistry? Please. Name one time you ever used chemistry in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use chemistry every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a    doctor, Mom. I'm not going to    be a doctor. I can't even say    the word 'orifice,' let alone put    a finger up one. The BEEP BEEP of Drew's alarm WATCH signals time to go. Drew is trying to cover up, but she's reeling from the news that her mother's going to accompany her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew's room looks like a four-star hotel suite. Almost trembling with tension, she ENTERS and immediately sits down at her desk with her DAYPLANNER, turning to the present DATE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, honey! Let's tear up Manhattan! With a shiver, Drew closes the book, looks up into the mirror, takes a squirt off her inhaler to calm herself and tries some self-reassurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're smart. You're resourceful. You'll find a way to make it work. She tries to sell herself on this by smiling, but something in the smile suggests SHE'S SCREWED. Collecting her Dayplanner, purse, interview file and cell phone, she drops them into her matching Coach shoulder ba EXT. DRIVEWAY - MacLEOD HOUSE - MORNING Quinn hops in her Saab. ANGLE ON the doorway, where Drew pauses, takes a deep breath to brace herself, then walks like a condemned prisoner to her mother's car and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING! Quinn's CELL PHONE goes off. Quinn looks annoyed, checks the incoming number. Drew closes her eyes and prays. QUINN (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor MacLeod... (beat; winking at Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but my itinerary is booked solid today. Call Dr. Wessels. He's covering for me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it's the baby's head? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'm coming. Frustrated, Mom hangs up and with a look of profound disappointment, turns to Drew. QUINN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, hon. It's a Blue Light special in Maternity. Every bed's full and some poor woman is about to give birth in the gift shop. I have to go in. Drew musters her best sad, sad face for her mom. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, darn it, Mom. That's a shame. It's like fate is conspiring against us. QUINN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You absolutely, positively have to promise me we'll do it another time. QUINN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. I better hurry. Have Parker drop you at the train station on her way to school, will you? Quinn gives her daughter a smile and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill 'em in that interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you know, I might not get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? You're Drew MacLeod. Nobody's smarter, nobody works harder and nobody, and I mean nobody, is ever more prepared. Drew smiles, hugs her mom and jumps out, waving as her mom backs down the drive and disappears down the street. With the weight of the world suddenly lifted from her shoulders, Drew looks to the sky and mouths, "thank you." This is when Parker comes hauling down the driveway in her Honda Accord. Drew signals her to stop, so of course her sister IGNORES HER and jets into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Stop! Drew takes off running after the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commuters all jump from their cars and into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker pulls up to the curb at the station.       Drew collects her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck with your interview. Drew pauses, holding the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Parker. Chemistry is important. When you think about it, everything's made of chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm interested in chemistry. Just not the kind with all the numbers and stinky test tubes. Drew shuts the door and hustles off into the train station. Parker SIGHS, looks to the BLACKBERRY on the seat next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew finds a seat.     She neatly folds her jacket and se it next to her. She pulls out a lumbar support pillow and tucks it behind her -- just right. Next, she takes out a tiny inflatable lap desk, blows it up and sets it across her lap. A pen goes in the little holder. Coffee from her Thermos. After laying out her interview materials, she turns to her reflection in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low; rehearsing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Spaulding. Good afternoon. I'm Drew MacLeod. An EXECUTIVE takes the aisle seat next to her, and after a sideways glance at Drew's portable office, opens his Wall Street Journal as the train begins to pull away. EVERY COMMUTER is quietly reading the paper or staring off into their own world, wondering why their life has lead them to this sad moment when... ... they're all distracted by an AWFUL, AWFUL VOICE singing Sheryl Crow's "Soak Up the Sun." It's Parker, wearing her headphones and looking for a seat in the full train car. Drew stares at her, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too loud; with headphones on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening. Wait, I know. This is one of those Ground Hog Day dreams, isn't it? Drew pinches herself too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! (to Parker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm awake now. You're supposed to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still too loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I just got this itch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then scratch it and get back to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't concentrate anyway. I'm too... distracted today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're permanently distracted. It's called Attention Deficit Disorder. (spotting her Blackberry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about that chat room guy? It is, isn't it? A look from the Exec reminds Parker of her headphones and she pulls them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's about spontaneity, which you obviously wouldn't know anything about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, Parker, you go through boyfriends like Junior Mints. It's pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pathetic? You want to talk about pathetic?! At least I don't count getting accidentally felt up in dodge ball as my first date!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be eighteen and you've never even HAD a boyfriend! The EXECUTIVE furrows his brow at Drew -- never?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this any of your business? He goes back to his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. I don't    have time for this today. Fine.      Don't graduate from high school.     Make a mess of your life over some complete stranger. I don't     care. But leave me out. I have something important I need    to accomplish today, so please    go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like this seat so you two can fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you. Drew's ALARM WATCH BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to mentally preview my day now. I can't talk anymore. Parker turns to go, then remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Drew? Do you have any money? I don't have enough for a ticket. Drew just rolls her eyes and turns her back on her sister. The Executive peers over his spectacles at Parker with the old paternal reprimand look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   Like you never ditched school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's got her headphones back on and is SINGING Uncle Cracker's "Follow Me," torturing everyone in her car. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You don't know how you met me...' But when she spots the CONDUCTOR ENTERING the front of the car, she abruptly stops, slips down in he seat and slides past the COMMUTER LADY next to her into the aisle. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Parker heads the opposite direction from the ticket- taking Conductor and out the back of the train car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker stands by the door, waiting, listening to hear if the coast is clear. Sounds good. She cracks the door, steps out on tiptoes, closes the door and THERE'S THE CONDUCTOR. He smiles. CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticket, please. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I save the b.s. story and just ask you to cut me a break this one time because I know you've got a big heart and you remember what it was like when you were young and... and... (off the Conductor's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... randy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's on the platform. The Conductor climbs back on the train into the FIRST CAR. PARKER (calling after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you were never young and randy! This is when she sees Drew sitting in the train window, smiling and giving her a little victory wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Conductor heads up the aisle -- does a double-take when he sees Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. He takes her by the arm. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Drew scrambles to grab her bag, jacket, the little inflatable lap desk falling to the floor. CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to be nice about it, but if you want the police involved, this is the way to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police?     I didn't do anything. CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ticket, no train ride. DREW (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's not me! That was my twin sister you threw off! CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady, in thirty years I have heard every possible line but that's the lamest ever. DREW (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right there!

dialogues.speaker: THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: No Parker. He hauls Drew down the aisle but as they EXIT THE CAR,

dialogues.speaker: SHE BUMPS HEAD-ON INTO BIKE MESSENGER/PRE-MED/MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: CLIMBER/MALE MODEL GUY -- they really do CRACK FOREHEADS,

dialogues.speaker: IN TIME WITH DREAM GUY
dialogues.text: BOTH OF THEM SHAKE OFF THE WOOZIES.     He smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine, considering she should be in jail. As the Conductor escorts her down the stairs, she and Dream Guy share a last look before she's... ... left on the platform just as the train's pulling out. Still no sign of Parker and Drew doesn't have all her wits about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This   can't be happening! I have a...   a... little paper thingy. What   are they called? Ticket! I have   a ticket! It's right... She drops her bag, contents spilling willy-nilly. On her hands and knees, she frantically searches for her ticket in the mess. The Conductor, however, is already on the train stop as it pulls away. He just waves, victorious. Parker    steps back out onto the platform and the Conduc spots    her. He looks from one sister to the other -- oops,    mistake. But it's too late. Sheepishly, he climb inside    and the train is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the gods)

dialogues.speaker: AARRGGH
dialogues.text: Parker steps up from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get kicked off, too? Why didn't you just buy a ticket? Parker stoops to help collect a couple of things but Drew, mad at hell, swats her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just a minor concussion I sustained while the Conductor was throwing me off the train because he thought I was you sneaking back on the train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet. Drew throws her bag over her shoulder and heads for the ticket counter. The WELT on her forehead is gonna be a doozey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am!    Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see when the next train leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already -- But Drew's inside the stationhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- did. They said something about a delay. Parker follows into the stationhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with frustrated COMMUTERS. Drew's standing in a long line at the ticket counter, steaming, turning a cold shoulder on... ... Parker, who walks right through to the street side.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Parker steps outside where it's just as crowded. She scopes the situation, which isn't good -- stranded COMMUTERS jostle for the few remaining TAXIS. TWO EXECUTIVES get into a shoving match. To the left, a couple of BLACK LINCOLN TOWN CARS -- standard car service rigs -- sit IDLING, each with a DRIVER next to it, holding up his sign with his client's name scratched on it. An EXECUTIVE (#2) passes her, finger in the air, signaling the FIRST DRIVER who holds a sign that read: "Wilcox." EXECUTIVE #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me. With no further ado, the driver opens the back door for him, the Exec climbs in, the driver hustles around to his side and in an instant, the car leaves the chaos behind. Parker raises an eyebrow.    Hm. The second driver (BENNIE) with a head like a cinder block and no neck, is talking on his cell phone and holding up a sign, "SCARPELLI." Parker shoots a finger into the air. This barely gets his attention but he nods, nonchalantly. Parker signals again -- one minute -- then turns back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew has reached the counter, where a bitter TRAIN CLERK who wishes he'd paid attention in school is tired of angry commuters. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be.  I have to be there before two! TRAIN CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe if you flap your arms real fast you can fly there, because you won't get there on a train. DREW (about to explode)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parker arrives in the nick of time, pulling her by the ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Hurry. I got us a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my arm. But Parker drags her away. Drew shoots a look back at the Clerk, who sticks out his tongue at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker pulls Drew toward the Town Car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car service? You couldn't have called for a... But Bennie opens the door for Parker like he's done it a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. Thank you.   My sister's coming, too. Drew KNOWS SOME SKETCHY SHIT IS GOING DOWN buy she's only got this instant to consider. She glances at the STRANDED MOB descending on a lone approaching CAB, engulfing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to make that interview, or not? Drew lets herself be pulled inside. Bennie shuts the door and waddles around to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker tries to play cool -- Drew's rigid -- angry and afraid. Bennie checks his invoice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're headed to the Teamster's Hall on Second Street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing a lip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Mister... She checks his Chauffeur's License up front:        Benja Loyola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Loyola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bennie? We have a slight change of itinerary. We need to go into Manhattan. 57th and 5th will be fine. Bennie doesn't seem perturbed a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pre-paid.     No skin off my nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering throughout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-paid? What's 57th and 5th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering throughout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barneys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Barneys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got five hours.     Relax. He FIRES UP the LINCOLN and off they go. Drew now has a pretty clear inclination as to what's going on. She leans into her sister and WHISPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was supposed to be someone else's car, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Just then, Bennie tosses the sign, which he'd stashed on the dash, onto the seat next to him, face up so Drew can read:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scarpelli'?   We're supposed to be Italian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northern Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so... wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You need to get to that interview. We now have a ride. We will pay for the ride. End of big deal. This is when Bennie's CELL PHONE RINGS and he answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  The city. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'a you talkin' about? Bennie glances into the REARVIEW MIRROR, smiling at the girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already got 'em. ... but his smile TURNS DOWN AT THE CORNERS as he listens. The girls exchange doubtful looks. It gets worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right here in the car. (to girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me. Bennie RAISES THE PRIVACY GLASS but doesn't realize he's left the intercom button on so they can still hear his half of the conversation. The girls are PETRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think that's a little severe? I mean, they didn't see nothin' yet. They can't hear nothin'. YES THEY CAN and they're now scared as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the boss. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. I'll fix it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't have a shovel. Not today. It'll be a big mess. Besides, I just had this suit cleaned. The girls want OUT OF THIS CAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take 'em to the wharf, what difference does it make? Drew yanks out her inhaler and sucks on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered terror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I think maybe we should get out. Parker sees the LIGHT AHEAD TURN RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.   How about... NOW! Just as Bennie brakes for the light, Parker throws her door open and pulls Drew into the street! An ONCOMING BUICK LOCKS UP its BRAKES as they dash for the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey?!   Where you goin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit the sidewalk and without breaking stride, race around the first corner, looking back over their shoulder. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stuck at the light! VRROOOM!   Here comes the Lincoln storming around the corner. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no respect for traffic laws! They run into the first ALLEY and hunker down by a GARBAGE CAN. The Lincoln flies past. They dash back out, the same way they came. SCREECH!   Bennie LOCKS UP the WHEELS! They round the same corner going the opposite way and Parker pulls them into the first door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where they crouch down the magazine rack. Among the magazines is DOG FANCY with a picture of a Chinese Crested Hairless on the cover and the headline: "EMPEROR

dialogues.speaker: DEFENDS CROWN."
dialogues.text: Parker peers over the top and out the window. PARKER'S POV -- slowly, the Lincoln cruises the street, Bennie scanning the neighborhood for them. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he gone? I can't believe this. What did you get us into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost him.    Wow. That was a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rush?   Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   Give me a quarter, will ya? Spooked, they both turn to find a scraggly HOMELESS GUY with a Slushee in his hand. They stand. Parker reaches in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here, Uncle Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Homeless Guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any change, but here. Parker starts to find the Homeless Guy a dollar but Drew reaches over to stop her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, you're only feeding the poor man's disease. Buy him a healthy snack. ... just as the Homeless Guy reaches for the dollar and the SLUSHEE IS KNOCKED FROM HIS HAND. We watch in SLOW MOTION AS THE SLUSHEE TAKES FLIGHT, THE

dialogues.speaker: FACED, DRENCHING HER.
dialogues.text: The Homeless Guy snags the dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. And he EXITS.     Parker SNIFFS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew. That stinks. That's not just Slushee. The MINI-MART CLERK approaches them, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mad Dog. Look at that mess. It's gonna smell up the store all day. Drew appears STUNNED, unable to form words so Parker speaks for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we use your bathroom please? The cherry syrup and cheap wine concoction drips down Drew's blank face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas station at the end of the block. Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT, who has no teeth, hands over the restroom key to the girls. The key is attached to a full-sized STEERING WHEEL. Burt SNIFFS, wrinkling his nose. BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's not my place to say, but you young girls got your whole lives ahead of you. You shouldn't be drinkin' at this hour of the day. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I keep telling her. BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Round the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls practically have to drag the key around to the restroom on the side. Parker puts the key in and slowly... slowly... CREAKING... opens the GATES OF HELL

dialogues.speaker: BEAT, THEN
dialogues.text: GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting side by side. A YOUNG MOTHER sits in front of them with her NINE-MONTH-OLD BABY who's standing on the seat facing the girls. Drew's BUMP on her forehead is large and inflamed, her hair a stringy, ratty mess of booze and red-dye number four and glucose. She is in a REALLY BAD MOOD, only staring straight ahead. Parker's playing peek-a-boo with the baby and trying to lighten up her sister's mood. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be fine. (to baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peek-a-boo! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're practically there. We'll get you cleaned up, you'll get into the program and... (to baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peek-a-boo! (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we'll both look back on this and laugh our butts off. BLECCH! The BABY PUKES all over Drew.       She looks sideways at her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never, ever, forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls over then pulls away, leaving the girls on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?   New York. We made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be arrested for vagrancy looking like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.   I've got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No ideas. I'm going straight to that interview and wait, without moving or speaking, especially to you, for four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! We're going to the Plaza! We can be Eloise! We'll get a nice room, you can take a shower and I'll swap clothes with you! Simple as that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the slightest clue what that would cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? You've got the emergency credit card Mom gave you, right? Drew's suddenly looking at her EMPTY HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   My. God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your, uh, stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near coma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left it in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows where I live. He's going to hunt me down and kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Drew. I don't think even the Mafia kills people just for scamming a ride. Quit being paranoid. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we don't do the Plaza. I've got... Parker digs in her pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six dollars and thirty-two cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't get me hosed down at a car wash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we thinking? You've got your secret-safety twenty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My secret-safety twenty. Of course. But it's only for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parker looks her sister right in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Drew takes off her shoe, lifts the inner sole and pulls out a twenty, then realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how'd you know about my secret-safety twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not important now. But let's just say that it's a good thing for you I think those shoes are so ugly I never borrowed them. (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how about there? Parker points to hotel where the dilapidated sign reads: THE RITZY PLAZA -- HOURLY RATES, HOT TUBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to get clean, not contract hepatitis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-six dollars and thirty-six cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We touch nothing. Parker leads them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks like a good place to get your throat cut fighting over a dime's worth of crack. There's no real       lobby, just a small area to stand a "desk" which is       behind iron bars. Behind the iron b rabbit-eared TV       with a busted-in tube houses a dead houseplant. An        old easy chair leaks stuffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?    Anybody?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Above, a BABY SCREECHES. Something BREAKS.        Then a DISEMBODIED VOICE SPEAKS to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your pants on. What'dya want? The girls look behind them, nobody.       Behind the bars Still nobody. What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't got all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a room... with a shower. Just for an hour. There's the sound of something SCRAPING across the floor and then the MIDGET HOTEL CLERK appears behind the counter. Now he's standing on a STOOL and we don't know what he was doing behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting oriented)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the room or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty dollars an hour for this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting; covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- really nice place. How much for half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you two were in school you could figure out that half a sixty is thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only got twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think because I'm short you can just charm me into making some deal, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all we have. Twenty-six dollars and thirty-six cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the one that stinks so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a little accident, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right, don't    get your underwear in a bunch.     As a public service, just 'cause    you stink so bad, you can have    it for twenty-five. He retrieves a key and holds it up just out of reach between the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-dollar deposit on key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of 'That is all the money we have' didn't make sense to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir,   that's every last cent we have   in the world. I swear to you,   we aren't planning to steal your   key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you some special deal, the next thing you know, you two are telling everybody, hey, this midget was a real sap. We gave him some sob story and the little guy just busted up into crocodile tears and handed over the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise we won't tell anyone. Will we, Drew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word.      Girl Scout's honor. He grudgingly holds out the key for Parker, who takes it and hands it to Drew while she gets the money out. ON DREW -- sensing something, she looks down at her feet where a HUGE RAT is licking the sweet stuff off her shoes. There's a rather LONG BEAT while this horror sinks in, then:

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHH
dialogues.text: Key in hand, Drew makes a beeline out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew?!   DREW?! Parker follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back with my key! The Desk Clerk jumps off his stool, opens his cage and follows them into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, Drew sprints down the sidewalk with Parker and the Desk Clerk in tow. Laying the hammer down, the Desk Clerk blasts past Parker -- he's a midget, but he's got wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew!    STOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN is giving birth. Her husband holds her hand. Quinn and a nurse are at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Greenspan? You're going to have to help. I need you to push. But they don't have her attention which is riveted on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?   The baby? Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "TODAY SHOW" SECURITY GUARDS and NYPD descend on the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.   Who's the wise guy? Parker pulls Drew out of the pile-up and grabs the key, tossing it away from them, sending the Desk Clerk scrambling after it. The two girls HIGH TAIL IT around the corner.       Winde they stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that little guy could really motor. Why'd you bolt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a rat, Parker. A rat the size of a Doberman eating my foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was all our money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our money?   OUR MONEY?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Key down, you're going to have an attack.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Drew's sucking on her inhaler but is so irate she spits out the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, it was not 'our' money and this is not 'our' day in New York. What it is, is quite possibly the most important day of my life. I've resigned myself to the fact that you don't give a crap about what you do with yours, but if you could find it in your heart, your tiny, cold steel heart, to respect what this means to me, I would appreciate it. But Parker's not listening.       She's staring intently. ... ACROSS THE STREET where several TOWN CARS are parked, the DRIVERS chatting next to a HOT DOG/PRETZEL CART. Among them is Bennie, sipping coffee.       Parker spots and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even listening. That's typical. Look, we're splitting up. Give me back my secret safety money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still looking past Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I told you not to be paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I meant was, it isn't paranoia if someone really is chasing you. Parker tries to subtly indicate with her eyes that Drew should look across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Drew finally turns and she, too, freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.   Don't run. He'll see us. Not wanting to draw his attention, the Girls shuffle off quickly down the street. ON Bennie -- squinting across at them. Can he make them out in the crowd? He nods to ANOTHER DRIVER, tosses his coffee cup and climbs in behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: HE SAW US
dialogues.text: The girls break into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he find us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just coincidence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe WE TOLD HIM WHERE WE WERE

dialogues.speaker: GOING
dialogues.text: She points up at the street sign -- 57th and 5th.   Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Parker leads her into traffic, HORNS BLARING, as they weave their way across. On the far side, a HORSE CARRIAGE pulls away from the curb and at the last minute, Parker spots a fresh pile of... ... HORSE SHIT, which she manages to leap. Drew, however, ISN'T GOING TO MAKE IT OVER. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump! Drew stumbles, wrong-foots the takeoff but somehow manages to get across it to the curb. For just a BEAT, we see her surprised face. Hm. I did it. Then they see Bennie crossing in traffic, huffing and puffing after them and not seeing the pile, which he hits in full stride, slips on, and PLOPS INTO on his ass. This gives the girls the opening they need and they ditch inside some revolving doors.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: IN THE STREET, Bennie's getting up, brushing the crap off. When a CAB HONKS at him, he gives it an Italian salute and slaps the hood, but when he reaches the curb it's clear: He's lost the girls.

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND PARKER
dialogues.text: DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this anymore. I want to be done. No more rats, no more mob hit men. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Cinderella, your wish has come true. (gesturing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voila, La Plaza, mademoiselle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?     Hello?   No dinero? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've got what I'd like to call a 'creative solution' to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     I'm calling Mom. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good will that do? DREW (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have her... uh... PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have her what? Hi, Mom? Could you leave that baby halfway outta there and drive into the city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, then. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, hey. Drew. Complete loser. Couldn't get to an interview by myself, need full bail out. Yeah. I'm the one who was going to change the world, I just couldn't get across town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Parker, my itinerary is shot to hell! Blue, red -- Her WATCH ALARM BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what that means! I'm running out of time. (noticing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that guy looking at me? Parker starts to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you ask a question like that, the person is going to look. Drew drags her behind a palm. Sure enough, across the lobby, a guy dressed as PLAINCLOTHES HOTEL SECURITY (MORTY SESTERO) now pretends he wasn't keeping an eye on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, we haven't done anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm standing in the lobby of the Plaza looking like a deranged street person who might attack at any moment. In fact, I might attack at any moment. The ELEVATOR behind them opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. The girls slip into the elevator.     When it closes, Morty's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls climb out of the elevator and sneak to the end of the hall where Parker stops and peers back around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing? And why am I whispering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting you a shower. Blake Greer pulled this at the Sheraton after the prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now we're emulating Blake Greer, voted most likely to commit a felony before having to shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to steal anything. We're just going to sneak in, use a little soap and water and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're not going to steal anything. Super. Just a little 'breaking and entering.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to break anything. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to enter, however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   No.   No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... here comes somebody. DOWN THE HALL a door swings open and MR. AND MRS. LO BIANCHO, wealthy Bostonians, EXIT their suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS -- at the opposite end of the hallway, Parker and Drew aren't the only ones watching. A PAINTER with one lazy eye, ROGER, pauses with his roller and carefully peeks around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the New York Kennel Club, Emile, not the New York Knickerbockers. Please call the caterer and cancel the beer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR OPENS       for them and they step in. Parke RUNS LIKE HELL for       the door of their suite... it's about to close when       she SLIDES LIKE PETE ROSE INTO just getting a hand       on it. She lies there on the floor, holding the door and WHISPERS LOUDLY to Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to have to do this, but... look in the mirror behind you. ON DREW -- bracing herself, she turns slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Practically sewn to Parker, Drew follows her into the suite, both nervous, tiptoeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housekeeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the hallway, the PAINTER watches the suite door close. Hm. What are those girls doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lavish, yaddada yaddada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, you're not a criminal. You just smell like one. This way.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parker leads her to the big double doors of the master bedroom and slowly OPENS them. There, on the bed, is THE EMPEROR, defending champion of the New York Kennel Club Dog Show. A CHINESE CRESTED HAIRLESS with his little crown sticking straight up, he may be the most absurd-looking dog in history. He simply eyes them. He might even be smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  Oh my god. A... a... (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm itching already.   See?   Are my arms red? Drew backs away -- she's about to break for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Key down. I'll take him in the living room and keep a lookout. You just get in that shower. Parker approaches The Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baby talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, little guy. You don't look so tough, huh? You don't look much like a dog, actually. More like Woody Woodpecker. Happy to give the company, The Emperor practically jumps into Parker's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're cute, aren't you, in a freakazoidal kinda way. She takes him into the living room and moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was your daddy a rat? Is that it? Well, I still like you. Parker, holding The Emperor, opens the door a crack to keep a lookout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway's empty. But The Emperor, feeling frisky, leaps from her arms into the hallway, then turns TO face her. Come on. Let's play!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here, little ratdog. Come to Mommy Parker. Parker pulls off a shoe and sticks it in the doorway to keep it from closing, then, hesitantly, trying not to spook him into running away from her, she steps into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sure enough, just as she gets close, he turns and dashes down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad ratdog! She chases him down the hallway     and then around the corner where they have to dodge     cans of paints, a lad until finally The Emperor slides     on some plastic sheeting, careens into a can of     mauve paint and is COVERED. Arms reach down, pick him up and Parker looks up to see the Painter (ROGER) with the now-mauve Emperor in his arms. PARKER (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Bye bye. No. He turns and RUNS for the stairwell door marked EXIT. Parker, completely baffled, finally calls after him: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your dog!      Hey!

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATORS AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: as they open   and the HOUSE SECURITY GUY (Morty) steps out, looking both ways and spotting one thing awry... ... a shoe holding open the door to the Lo Bianchos' suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew finishes struggling out of the last of her sticky clothes and gets ONE FOOT IN THE SHOWER WHEN SHE HEARS: HOUSE SECURITY GUY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Mrs. Lo Biancho? House security!

dialogues.speaker: POOR NAKED DREW FREEZES. THE WORLD STOPS SPINNING ON ITS
dialogues.text: AXIS. Panicking, she grabs the shower curtain, pulling it off its hanger and covering herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECURITY GUY snoops toward the bedroom doors. Just as he reaches for the handle, the door swings open, SHADOCK, clocking him and dropping him. Wrapped in the shower curtain, Drew races across the living room. Just as she reaches the hallway, Parker's there, also at a dead run and they don't even break stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DREW (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a man in there! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody took the dog! They reach the end of the hallway and are TRAPPED. Only one out. Parker HUFFS OPEN the window to the fire escape and they climb out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and scurry down the stairs only to find that THE LADDER DOESN'T REACH.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parker hangs and then drops onto the top of a DUMPSTER with one side of the lid still closed, then jumps to the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! But DREW'S FROZEN WITH FEAR and to complicate matters, she's struggling to keep the curtain wrapped around herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll, uh, go around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?!    It's only a little ways! JUMP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbing his sore head, Morty the Security Guy lumbers down the hallway. BEHIND HIM Mr. and Mrs. Lo Biancho get out of the elevator:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peeved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When competing in a dog show, best to bring one's dog along, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had him, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up her hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?   Empty. But now they both notice the DOOR to their suite is wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear God! The elderly couple do their version of a panicked run inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screeching)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON MORTY -- making an abrupt halt. Baby?!          He tur around and lopes back to the suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lo Biancho? I'm Mort Sestero, hotel security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!   Please help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone took your baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhat relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor is a dog, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not 'a' dog, no. THE NEW YORK

dialogues.speaker: AREN'T YOU TRYING TO FIND HIM
dialogues.text: Morty pulls his RADIO as he backs out the door and heads down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Remote One to base, Remote One to base. Code 12, I repeat, Code 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You goin' to lunch already, Morty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code 12 isn't lunch, Bruce! Didn't you read your manual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call NYPD.    We have a dognapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just call the damn police and patch me through. The Emperor's been kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cripes, why didn't you say it was political?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Political?     THE EMPEROR IS A DOG,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to call NYPD about a dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (decrying his fate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to kill you, then fire you, Bruce. Got it? Kill, fire. That order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew's still FROZEN on the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can!

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: where Roger appears with The Emperor. Surprised        to the girls, he backpedals, worried he'll be seen,       bu they're too wrapped up in their own getaway and       he quietly makes his way to his VAN (painted on the       ba sides: "Michelangelo's Painting: A Masterpiece         ev time".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun in prison. Under 'Summer Internships' on your college application, you can write 'license plate manufacturing.'

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Roger's VAN SQUEALS AWAY, drawing Parker's attention. She glimpses him in his side mirror as he disappears around the corner into traffic. Shutting her eyes, Drew drops onto the closed lid of the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it. Oops, the curtain starts to slip. When she reaches for it she loses her balance and suddenly -- FWONK -- nosedives into the dumpster. The curtain floats INTO THE ALLEY at Parker's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me... my... curtain. Parker tosses the curtain in and Drew climbs out. hurry off down the alley. IN THE SECOND STORY FIRE ESCAPE WINDOW -- Morty appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!    Bring back that dog! MORTY'S POV -- The girls near the end of the alley. A small dog could easily be concealed under that shower curtain. ON THE GIRLS -- running full-tilt, Drew turns to Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks we have the dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A painter took it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pain -- WHAM! -- Drew's       CLOTHESLINED at the intersection by BIKE MESSENGER       who, in a valiant attempt to avoid h brakes so hard       he flies off the handlebars and land RIGHT ON TOP OF       HER.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's DREAM GUY from the train and for a confused BEAT they look into each other's familiar faces where we read recognition, love, unstated chemistry, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, one of us is gonna get hurt if we keep doing this. O.S. SIRENS signal that the police are now involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, complete stranger!      Get off my sister! Parker yanks Drew from underneath Dream Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm, uh, late for this place, thing, where I'm supposed to be. College. Interview!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where at? But Parker's got her by the arm and she can only call back over her shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: NYU
dialogues.text: ... before disappearing into the CROWD on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too late)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too! AROUND THE CORNER comes Morty who, without time to react, trips headfirst over Bike Messenger Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls weave through the PEDESTRIANS but spot a COP CAR SCREECHING to a halt in front of them and quickly take a left into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to now? Thinking fast, Parker pulls on a door -- locked -- the next door SWINGS OPEN as if by divine providence and two HIGH FASHION MODELS step past them out while the girls step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. MODELS, DRESSERS, SYCOPHANTS, "I ONLY DATE MODELS" GUYS and the famous couture fashion designer, BOBO, are mid-show and friggin' frantic. BOBO (French accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?! No more breaks! Do you hear me! We have a show to do, you nitwits! Models! BAH! You have hollow gourds for heads! The kind they make those Mexican rattles out of!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (always at his elbow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maracas. BOBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maracas! Maracas that take coffee breaks when I am paying them a

dialogues.speaker: FORTUNE
dialogues.text: Bobo spots the girls coming through the back door and physically grabs them both, pushing them at the Showrunner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair!  Makeup! (Parker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daywear! (Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clubbing! Vite! This is when he gets a load of Drew's matted hair, running makeup and shower curtain and does a double-take. Hm. Does he like it? BOBO (confess)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Helmut Lang? (recovering himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! The Showrunner shoves Drew one way, Parker the other -- Drew looks at her -- what the hell? Parker CLEARLY MOUTHS: HAIR! MAKEUP! CLOTHES! and TEAMS OF DRESSERS virtually surround them. INSIDE THE MOB OF DRESSERS SURROUNDING DREW the HAIR STYLIST raises his brush and scissors, but PAUSES. The rest of the team stops, watching him make his decision. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfection. He excuses himself and the others begin shoving her into couture.

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING TEAM
dialogues.text: And   the DRESSING TEAM surrounding Parker parts, reveali her   in a very un-Parker-like, super-chic business suit. She   catches a glimpse of herself in the mirror and roll her   eyes. Boring. The DREW TEAM parts and    we are stunned to see they've chosen to drape her in a    show-stopping couture FREAK S OUTFIT that is some sort    of marriage between dominatri and nun, complete with a    habit and black leather bikin ON PARKER who spots Drew and is, for the first time in the movie, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does this not surprise me? THE NEXT MUSIC CUE COMES UP and the SHOWRUNNER grabs Drew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but I'm supposed to be going to my college interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's rich. A model going to college. What next? Talking monkeys? ... and pushes her through the curtains and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH go a hundred CAMERAS! Blinded, Drew stumbles forward on a nine-inch spiked heels down the catwalk. ON THE AUDIENCE -- ALSO SPEECHLESS. This is when Drew catches sight of herself on a TV MONITOR at the end of the walk.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her first instinct is to RUN, but suddenly THE AUDIENCE

dialogues.speaker: BRAVO
dialogues.text: Drew recovers herself a bit.        Wow.   They're clappi me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's watching through the curtains when she spots Morty leading two NYPD DETECTIVES (WILLIAMSON AND HOGAN) through the back door. Uh-oh. The Showrunner's holding her arm, waiting to throw her onstage but when Morty turns in her direction, Parker takes the initiative and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... jumps onstage, vamping it down the catwalk like she was born to it. Drew's still at the end of the runway, basking in the APPLAUSE and attempting to negotiate a precarious turn in her SCARY SPIKED HEELS when Parker approaches her and... ... throws a hand on her hip, thrusts it out -- sexy executive! and leans into her sister:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel guy's here. The juxtaposition of the TWO POLAR OPPOSITE OUTFITS draped over twins suddenly throws the audience into PAROXYSMS OF APPRECIATION for the inspiration of the artist and they call him out! Bobo! BOBO! AUTEUR!

dialogues.speaker: BRAVA
dialogues.text: Here comes a smiling Bobo, through the curtains, blowing kisses and heading for the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the police. Bobo presses himself between the girls, taking their hands and beginning his bows, but the girls spot Morty peeking from backstage, and they TAKE OFF, leaping off the front of the stage into the audience like punks jumping into the mosh pit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ADORING CROWD holds them up and they CROWD SURF toward the rear of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody washed their hands, right?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Spotting the commotion, he and the two cops race down the catwalk. Realizing he'll never get through the crowd, he, too, leaps off the stage to surf toward them but... THE CROWD ABRUPTLY PARTS and he does a complete FACE PLANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that explains why he's a security guard.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: who bust out the back doors of the large room and unwittingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... right back into The Plaza lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what they call 'returning to the scene of the crime'? Unfortunately for them, to get to the front door they have to pass by... ... the PLAZA MANAGER and the other HOUSE SECURITY AGENT, BRUCE (butch haircut, bad suit), consoling Mrs. Lo Biancho. When MORTY and the COPS come through the doors behind them, however, there's no choice. The girls try to look as inconspicuous as possible heading for the revolving doors but they overhear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you, Mr. and Mrs. Lo Biancho, The Plaza will do everything in its power to see that The Emperor is safely returned and that the criminals are brought to justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justice?! I want them executed! Tortured first, slowly, and then beheaded!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plaza's policy is of course to serve you in any capacity we can. Morty spots the girls across the lobby just as they reach the revolving doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce!    10-80 at the wagon wheel! Bruce looks over to Morty like he's speaking Slavic, but Morty's furiously pointing and Bruce sees... THE GIRLS break for the revolving doors. Parker gets there first, plunges in so fast that a MAN ENTERING is tossed headlong into the lobby. Drew tries to time the quickly-spinning door but one of the very high SPIKED HEELS catches, throwing her forward and sandwiching her in the revolving door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Park... OUTSIDE -- Parker sees Drew caught in the door as Bruce, Morty and the cops close in. Quickly, Parker pushes the door back, releasing Drew, who jumps in and swings out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Parker HEAVES THE DOOR WITH ALL HER MIGHT, spinning it so fast the security guys and cops can't jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four men all stand there, watching the spinning door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Then, just    to their right, an ELDERLY WOMAN walks thro the regular    door just adjacent the revolving doors. Al four share    a sheepish look -- uh, maybe we should have thought of    that -- then BOLT outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police and security look left, right, across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They couldn't have gone very far. We'll split up. (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go that way! You take Fifth! Come on, get on your horse! Morty and Bruce take the cop's order and race off in separate directions. Neither Hogan nor his partner moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Williamson and Hogan step over to a hot dog cart set up next to a NEWSPAPER STAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to hot dog vendor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think those two went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me. They didn't have any stupid dog with them from what I could see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might have stashed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they ate it. The cops giggle at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rent-a-cop said the mutt's worth like 50 G's. That makes it grand theft, my friend. Five to ten.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEWS STAND
dialogues.text: where a BLIND CASHIER (SPEEDY) smiles at the two policemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to blind cashier)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Speedy. You didn't see a couple of blondes run past here, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Couldn't miss 'em. Real criminal types. Looked like they were headed to Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where they all go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS Drew and Parker, crouched down behind the counter right next to Speedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I see you first. The cops head back to The Plaza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we put Abbott and Costello on the ransom watch. I don't want to be stuck in the same room all day with Leona Helmsley's nasty stepsister.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With the Detectives gone, Speedy turns up his nose and waves the air, fanning away a bad smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew. You know, it's not some old wives' tale about blind people having an acute sense of smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What did you do with that dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't steal it, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A painter did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You girls best give yourselves up and tell 'em the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he's right. We're going to march in there and give ourselves up right this minute. They will, of course, take us down to the precinct, call Mom and Dad, we'll give our statement, they'll grill us under hot lights for a few hours, force us to confess with some tricky good cop/bad cop routine and the next thing you know we're doing five to ten in Attica. Drew checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll turn ourselves in right after the interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I make one suggestion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the showers before you do anything else. A BEEP BEEP indicates Parker's BLACKBERRY is receiving a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're facing felony charges, Parker. Maybe you can do your on- line flirting later. Better yet, he can see you during visitor's hours. Parker reads the incoming MESSAGE from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; epiphany)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Warren works in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren? WARREN?! So you lied, right to my face. No, Drew, this isn't about the chat room guy. Nah! But Parker's typing furiously even as Drew rants on -- she has to lean around Speedy's legs. A GUY buying a newspaper peers down at the strange sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your daughters to work day. The guy pays for his paper, leaves. NOTATWIN: WARREN. MY REAL NAME'S PARKER MACLEOD. SISTER AND I NEED A FAVOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
