dialogues.text: Are you listening to me?!   Give me that stupid thing! Drew reaches for the Blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Drew! This guy might be able to help. He lives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, you have completely lost your mind if you can be thinking about boys at a time like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United Nations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't possibly know somebody who works at the United Nations. Maybe he meant United Sub Sandwiches. Or United Skate Rats Store.

dialogues.speaker: SOON.
dialogues.text: Parker pockets the Blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. We're going to the United Nations to use the restroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How convenient. You arrange a little date while your sister's future hangs in the balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he said he'd help and it's only a couple blocks away. You got a better idea? Speedy opens the rear door of the newsstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (how's he know?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coast's clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Speedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite welcome.    Good luck in that interview. Drew SIGHS, then reluctantly follows Parker out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MacLEOD HOUSE - CHARLEY'S STUDY Head thrown back, mouth wide open, still in his        ba Charley sleeps in the chair directly in front of        h laptop. The SCREENSAVER, an animated version of         J Nicholson in THE SHINING, just keeps typing "All        w no play..." When the PHONE RINGS it nearly knocks him out of his chair. He hunts it down through the MAELSTROM on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wal-Mart? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Marvin. You bet.    Typing away. He glances at the screensaver, the same words pouring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I'm on a real roll, Marv. The juices overfloweth, if you get my meaning. Don't want to plug the juices when they're overflowing, right? (whoa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. I guess I could carve out some time.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Charley smells his armpit.       Ripe.   He'll need a qui shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.   See you in the City. Charley hangs up, punches a key on his computer.       Th screensaver disappears and up pops a BLANK PAGE.       At top: CHAPTER ONE. Nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley's driving,      eating a sandwich and dialing his PHONE at the same      time, veering dangerously and obliviously across      the center stripe. The oncoming C careens out of his      way in a blaze of HORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, beautiful Doctor Lady. How goes your day? (beat; huh?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right next to the magazine rack? What did they name it, Newsweek? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going into the City to meet some big shot publisher. Maybe I'll swing by NYU afterwards and see if I can give Drew a ride home. You talk to her today? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably having too much fun to call. I'll ring her up. Bye bye. He hangs up and of course veers into the other lane again, correcting wildly before resuming his merry way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far below, Garden employees set      up for the dog show. Inside, the Lo Bianchos' luxury      box is likewise bein prepared. In one corner, Bruce       and Morty are fumbli with the unfamiliar electronic      tracing gear, readyin the ransom call. Mrs. Lo Biancho turns up her nose at the buffet table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caterer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumaki, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumaki! Yech! You might as well wrap dog turds in bacon. Take them away. A SOCIETY FRIEND of Mrs. Lo Biancho, BABS, arrives to pay her respects, shuffling her feet across and leaning in to trade air kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea, Andrea. How dreadful!      I shudder to think how the poor Emperor may be suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Babs.     I'm at wit's end. When she turns on Morty and Bruce, they both jump a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on a show)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Tell the thieves I'll pay anything they want! Anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.     What price on a loved one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to    run. That stupid groomer used    a commercial conditioner    on Coco and she looks like trailer    trash. Babs nabs one of the rumaki on her way out. As soon as Babs is gone, Mrs. Lo Biancho looms over Morty and Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give them ten grand, tops, but only if the dog's back before show time.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A troubled Bruce isn't having much luck operating the trace machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Morty; whispered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to turn this on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls try to be as inconspicuous as possible walking cross-town in couture, Drew with only one shoe and in a bad mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to make it, Drew. You'll see. There's still plenty of time. You'll get cleaned up, we can trade clothes... this is a nice suit, huh? Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abrupt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get accepted, then we can explain the misunderstanding about the dog to the police and everything will be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe after the police forgive us for sneaking into someone else's hotel room, we can ask them to please keep the mob hit man from whacking us and dropping us into the marina so he doesn't get his suit dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I know you're trying to cheer me up, but I have to be honest. This is all your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fault? MY FAULT?! I didn't mean for any of this to happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right! Like you didn't mean to ask Bernie Lipscomb to the prom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet that was just another accident of yours that happened to screw up my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Lipscomb? (dawning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...? Drew didn't want to admit that -- it just slipped out under pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked Bernie, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I didn't.  I haven't seen you talk to a guy since we were in kindergarten and we thought Jerry Wester was a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked Bernie just to snake him from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, the really spooky thing is, that would mean we liked the same guy. A block away, the United Nations building stands majestically against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Directly in front of them, however, a POLICE CAR is stopped at the light with two uniformed POLICEMEN inside. The girls spot the Police and stop. The Police look up at the girls through their windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their on-board FAX is spitting out an APB PHOTO. The POLICEMAN on the passenger side pulls it off and holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that those two right there? He shows the PHOTO to his PARTNER who's driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned. But when they look up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the girls are gone. They don't take much notice of a HORSE-DRAWN CARRIAGE passing them with the DRIVER up front and TWO TOURISTS kissing in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did they go? As the carriage clops past, however, the Policemen don't notice the Girls -- both clinging to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 605 to Base. We spotted the dognapping suspects, corner of 1st and 49th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that, 605.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogan and Williamson are eating sandwiches but they've paused to listen: POLICE OPERATOR (V.O.) (from radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car 91, 605 reports suspects spotted at 1st and 49th. Hogan picks up the radio while Williamson FIRES UP the CAR. HOGAN (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 605, do you still have visual? POLICEMAN #2 (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. But they can't be far. They're on foot. WILLIAMSON (to Hogan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's over by the U.N. HOGAN (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if you can pick them up. We're on our way. Zoom!   Williamson blasts crosstown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horse Carriage passes the usual groups of PROTESTORS and TOURISTS outside on the U.N. Plaza and... ... the Girls jump off and move into the crowd, headed for the ENTRANCE where there's a LINE at the door. DOWN THE BLOCK the Detectives' unmarked car appears and parks at the curb. Williamson and Hogan climb out, scanning the crowd. WILLIAMSON (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just a glimpse as they ENTER the building.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: HOGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the world could they be doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girls pass through the metal detector and move toward a small group of TOURISTS waiting by the sign that reads: NEXT TOUR 11:00. DREW (re: Warren)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see him? Parker consults the JPEG PIC on her Blackberry, then scans the group. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. At the head of the group, the U.N. TOUR GUARD, geeky in a Clark Kent way and nice enough looking but definitely not a male model, leans into a petite BRUNETTE and her LITTLE SISTER. TOUR GUIDE (conspiratorially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how much I've looked forward to this. The Brunette looks at him like he's a serial killer. BRUNETTE (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma? Her fierce-looking BABUSHKA MOM gets in the Tour Guide's face. TOUR GUIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.   My mistake. This is when Drew notices Williamson and Hogan ENTERING and approaching a U.N. SECURITY GUIDE, flashing their badges. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.   What now? PARKER (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren? Does anyone know Warren Collier?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Tour Guide, WARREN COLLIER, looks over at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker? Warren moves back to Drew and Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Warren. Isn't that strange? I didn't recognize you from your picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an office or someplace private we could go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just have to do this tour and... But Williamson and Hogan, led by the U.N. Security Guy, ENTER the lobby. Drew grabs Warren by the arm and turns him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get back to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Parker looks Warren right in the eye.     This is a test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let me get somebody to cover for me. Warren leads them into a small adjoining office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where another TOUR GUIDE is taking a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Angie, take the 11:00 for me, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.    Judge Judy's on. Drew grabs Angie by the collar, lifts her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie?    Take the 11:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Warren)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me, Warren. Angie heads out to take the tour.        Parker turns on Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a lying sack, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do? I liked you. If I'd sent a real picture, would you have met me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means no. At least this way I got to see you before you blow me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is blowing you off, Warren. As a matter of fact, we're very happy to see you, aren't we, Parker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're grateful for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my sister, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not-a-twin, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. I guess everybody would like the world to see them a little bit differently than they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly interjecting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super. Now that that's all settled, is there a restroom I can get to without going out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with going out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police, for one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police?   I thought you guys were joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the kind of joke that will be a lot funnier a few years from now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that door's the only way out. There's a restroom at the end of the main hall. Parker opens the office door, peeking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see 'em.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMSON AND HOGAN
dialogues.text: who Parker can't see because her line of sight is blocked by the office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be searching the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you guys do, anyway?    Mug a couple supermodels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. With Warren leading the way, they EXIT the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three make their way across the vast lobby, but before they reach the main hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   You two! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! Almost instinctively, they go COMPLETELY SEPARATE WAYS, Warren and Parker breaking left, Drew right. Drew makes a mad dash down a hallway, makes a turn, another turn, working her way deeper into the labyrinth. Even while running frantically, she tries to smile politely at everyone she passes until she spots a WOMEN'S room and quickly ditches inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurriedly crosses, enters a stall, locks the door and puts her feet up. She tries to catch her breath. GROANS OF PAIN ECHO from the stall next to her. Somebody's in BAD SHAPE.      Another HEART-RENDING GROAN can't be ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to person in stall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near fatally nauseous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh... I'm so sick. The mussels at lunch. You have to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kind of in my own private hell right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew... it's vitally important. A FILE FOLDER comes skidding from under the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.    You have to take this to Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Canada?    It's sort of far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Assembly. Give the file to Mr. Wakefield, the Canadian representative. (GROANNN!!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I can't... get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to take this to the Canadian Representative to the United Nations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!    This is a crisis! What can she possibly do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused but...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Drew EXITS the stall and goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Assembly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the left.    Run! Drew peeks out the door.       It looks clear.   Out she

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the run, Warren and Parker ditch through a door marked MAILROOM. A BEAT LATER, Hogan appears from around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vacant and quiet. The DOOR OPENS SLOWLY and Hogan ENTERS. It's a small room with a few canvas mail sacks piled in a corner and a wall of mail-sorting cubbies. An in-house MONITOR mutely broadcasts the now empty ASSEMBLY ROOM. Nothing here, Hogan closes the door. IN A BEAT, one of the mail sacks wriggles and Warren sticks his head up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. Parker pops up from the same sack. Face to face, there's an awkward moment of attraction between them. WARREN (no better idea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have nice breath. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should get out of this sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew peeks in through the door, reading the COUNTRY IDENTIFICATIONS on the desks... Bangkok, Borneo, Bulgaria... Canada. The REPRESENTATIVES are in the middle of a heated DEBATE that we hear being translated (and we see in subtitles). CHINESE REP (Chinese; subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible! This would be globally destabilizing! BULGARIAN REP (pointing angry finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah!   Posturing and rhetoric!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The CANADIAN REPRESENTATIVE is sitting gingerly in his chair, shifting uncomfortably. He looks pale, shaky. Drew commits herself and rushes down the stairs to his desk with the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? He puts a hand to his stomach -- he's struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ugh; groan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You didn't have the mussels at lunch, too, did you? Even as she holds out the file, he races past her, puckering his bum. She watches him waddle up the stairs BUT AS HE EXITS, HE

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY.
dialogues.text: Drew sees them. Uh, oh. The only thing she can do to make herself inconspicuous is to drop into the Canadian Rep's chair and turn her back on them like she's one of the Assembly members. She sits up, shuffles the files around. Glancing furtively to either side, she sees that everyone else is wearing the TRANSLATION EARPHONE. She puts one on.

dialogues.speaker: THE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Williamson's gaze comes to rest on... ... THE BACK OF DREW'S HEAD.         Hm.   That looks fam This is when the CHINESE REP stands, furious, and points an accusatory finger at Drew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This crisis falls at the feet of one nation and one nation only!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you defend such a position! The world is waiting to hear! These are fighting words. The Assembly grows SILENT. Drew wishes she could BEAM HERSELF somewhere off planet. She gulps air. Glances left, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not certain... This furrows some brows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... that I NEED to defend our position! Ah, yes, some knowing nods. ON THE NORTH KOREAN REPRESENTATIVE leaning over to confer with the NORWEGIAN REPRESENTATIVE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird hairdo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is absurd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absurd?! Uhhh... where now? She notices the FILE the Rep in the bathroom gave her and holds it up, shaking it for emphasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dramatic emphasis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so absurd, since I have the documents right here in my possession! This draws a CHORUS OF MURMURS throughout the hall. The Chinese Rep suddenly looks terribly worried and pauses to confer with his ASSOCIATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's peeking through the door, checking the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to find Drew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something tells me that won't be too tough. Warren points to the MONITOR. Parker's jaw drops. sister is addressing the entire U.N. Assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew glances Williamson EXITING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And besides, who said absurd is necessarily bad? Sometimes absurd is good! For instance, absurd can be sort of... funny! In conclusion, I propose that all of you should talk amongst yourselves. (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Like Cinderella at Midnight, she turns and races up the stairs as the Assembly is in complete turmoil -- KOFI ANAN BANGS his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canada has proposed further debate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United States of America seconds the motion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew busts through the doors just as Warren and Parker come running with the Detectives chasing them. The three of them make for the front door but a TOUR GROUP comprise of a hundred young JAPANESE GIRLS blocks their EXIT. Warren thinks fast and YELLS IN JAPANESE. WARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jin zshe miya BRAD PITT! SCREAMING LIKE BANSHEES, the Japanese Girls all pour outside, Warren and the Girls following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once outside, he YELLS AGAIN. WARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dingo cashito, BRAD PITT ezukai! The JAPANESE GIRLS turn around and STORM BACK THROUGH THE DOORS, blocking Williamson and Hogan's EXIT. The three of them run for the line of taxis. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak Japanese? WARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not look like an underwear model, but I'm smarter than a hundred of them put together. Warren grabs a Taxi door. WARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any money! WARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm smart AND rich! Williamson and Hogan have fought their way out through the little Japanese Girls. Realizing they won't reach Parker and Drew in time, they head for their own unmarked cruiser which is parked just ahead of... Bennie's TOWN CAR. He's holding the door for a cigar- chewing CLIENT but watching the Girls climb into the cab up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump into the back seat, Warren in the middle. Parker leans urgently into the DRIVER: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow that... uh... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're following US, Parker! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.   JUST GO! The TAXI pulls away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Williamson FIRES UP the CRUISER. WILLIAMSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should give them a little leash and see what they do with it. HOGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But we're gonna have to stop for lunch pretty soon, 'cause I'm getting heartburn. They pull into traffic, following the Cab. In a BEAT, Bennie's Town Car follows, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker leans across Warren to Drew. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, what were you doing? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone was sick in the bathroom and they asked me to -- hold on, I don't owe you any explanation. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one all 'I gotta get to this interview or I'm gonna have a nervous breakdown' and yet you have time to address the United Nations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, technically, you have to have security clearance to enter the Assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a lot of nerve, Parker. It was you that got me tossed off the train! You had to give the bum that dollar! You get the suit, I get the leather bikini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which isn't so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you got Bernie Lipscomb while I got Scrabble with Mom and Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Bernie Lipscomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I didn't know you liked him! It was no big deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I know? You never tell me anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a good reason for that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know very well what it means, Ms. Big Mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big mouth?! Ooh, I hope you miss that stupid interview!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Well, the joke's on you, because there isn't any interview! Oops. This just slipped out in anger.        Parker's bra has to adjust, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No interview. I screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You screwed up what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scheduling the interview.    You deaf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Drew. Drew doesn't screw ANYTHING up, let alone scheduling. You're the Iron Chef of scheduling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed the deadline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they made the first cut from the preliminary application, we were supposed to send in a form to secure our interview time and I filled it out and had everything ready to go in the mailbox and then... Drew is near tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what? Earthquake? Tsunami? Nuclear winter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I just forgot. When I found it in my bag a week later, I'd missed the deadline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So today?   All this?   What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humiliated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I was going to try to meet Professor Spaulding and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just going to jump him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of a guerilla interview?     You know, I'm a big Michael Moore fan... A look from Parker quiets Warren.       Drew's choked up. just nods, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called and the secretary said there were no exceptions to the deadline so I was going to try to see him when he finished the other interviews. I knew it was hopeless, but... I was so... embarrassed. Drew wipes her tears, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, to hell with it. She opens the door and jumps out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew?!   Drew, get back in this taxi! Parker starts to open her door on the TRAFFIC SIDE! HONK HONK! It's nearly SHEARED OFF by a passing truck and she closes it just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, you really are a genius. As the taxi bogs down in traffic, Drew disappears around the corner up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about spontaneous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears running, Drew's walking too quickly for the one stupid shoe. She nearly turns her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darn it!   DARN IT DARN IT DARN IT! This is when she sees, parked just down the block... ROGER'S VAN with "Michelangelo's Painting" across the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... that's the painter. Drew quickly steps into the shadow of a doorway to keep out of sight and watch the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Williamson and Hogan have the same problem with the traffic and can't see clearly what's going on up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did one of them just get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.   Maybe she's going for the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's what they want us to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we stay with the taxi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you want to hoof it after the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay with the taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger dials a cell phone while The Emperor stands on the passenger seat with his front paws on the dash. As far as we can tell, he's having a great time being kidnapped and doesn't mind being mauve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the back, will ya? The Emperor ignores him, happily watching the streets of New York go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid dog. But his CALL has gone through.        He imitates a GIRL' VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as GIRL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS ACTION
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lo Biancho calmly answers her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Morty and Bruce have their tracing gear rigged to her phone but have to keep following her around the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Girl Voice throughout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to see your dog alive again, listen closely. I want a hundred thousand dollars transferred into this numbered Swiss account --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll give you ten grand but only if he's in Madison Square Garden in... She looks to her husband, who consults his watch and then holds up ONE FINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hour.   Take it or leave it. Bruce SIGNALS her -- keep him on the line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have one minute to decide. She hangs up.     Bruce and Morty SIGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger looks at the phone. It wasn't supposed to go like that. He looks at The Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Fancy Pants. You can wipe that stupid smile off your face. I don't think they love you as much as you think they do. He glances at his watch.      He believes Mrs. Lo Biancho is PANICKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker and Warren are scanning the sidewalk ahead for Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she took a right up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were the ones being followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay flexible, will you please? They turn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits redial.       Mrs. Lo Biancho answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Here's how we make the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- First of all, you forgot to disguise your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secondly, my husband will meet you in ten minutes on the corner of 43rd and Broadway. He'll have the money. Bring the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's ridiculous!     You'll just bring the police!     No way! Consider him Kung Pau!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hang up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police, it appears, have other priorities, like humans or something. And I assure you, the Hotel Security... people... will not interfere. In any case, little man, we just want the dog back before showtime, do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ciao. She hangs up.        Roger does, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to The Emperor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder you look so happy. As far as you're concerned, you've escaped from the Wicked Witch of the West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew watches as Roger climbs out, looks up and down the street, then moves around to the passenger side, grabs The Emperor and drops him into a gym bag. AT THE END OF THE BLOCK -- SPECTATORS for the New York Kennel Club Dog Show have begun filing into the Garden. Ever wary, Roger carries The Emperor under one arm. The Emperor pokes his nose out. Roger pushes it back in. The dog pokes it back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Emperor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off. Whoosh! From behind, DREW GRABS THE EMPEROR and takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    Give me that dog! Holding The Emperor at arm's length, Drew makes a run for it with Roger after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know that I'm allergic to you AND cynophobic! She and Roger race right past... ... Mr. Lo Biancho, holding out the Saks bag of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop!    I have to return this dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back! Puzzled, Mr. Lo Biancho falls in line behind Roger, keeping up pretty well for an old dude with a gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, isn't that your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be.    She's terrified of dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round the corner behind Parker and Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, I got a hunch these girls don't have anything to do with this dog. Drew blows past them, holding The Emperor. The Detectives exchange glances -- nice hunch -- and they LEAP OUT OF THE CAR TO JOIN THE CHASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he turns the corner, the PARADE PASSES HIM.   Wha the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor's having the time of his life. He licks Drew's face joyfully as she weaves through the growing crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS A UNIFORMED POLICEMAN doing security at the DELIVERY ENTRANCE to the Garden, where SHOW PARTICIPANTS, wheeling their DOG KENNELS, are being checked in by two SHOW OFFICIALS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Drew draws a bead on THE POLICEMAN, determined to reach him and hand over The Emperor: DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer?!   Officer?! But SHOW OFFICIAL #3 appears from inside, taps the Policeman on the shoulder -- they need him inside.   He turns and goes through the door just as... ... Drew reaches the loading dock and hustles up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer?! She sprints past the other SHOW OFFICIALS checking in CONTESTANTS. SHOW OFFICIAL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss! You can't go in without credentials!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS ACTION
dialogues.text: Drew has entered HER OWN PERSONAL CIRCLE OF HELL -- DOGS OF EVERY SHAPE AND SIZE SURROUND HER. DREW (to no one/everyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Policeman? A GROOMER combing a HOUND DOG points toward the CURTAINS on the far side of the room and she blasts off that direction.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE HOUND DOG -- lifting his big nose in the air, he sniffs mightily and then... BAYING LIKE HE'S COON HUNTING UNDER A KENTUCKY MOON, the Hound Dog leaps off his table, heads after Drew.

dialogues.speaker: CHAOS.
dialogues.text: The TWO SHOW OFFICIALS,    sporting nifty sweaters and manicures, are prepared    to sacrifice their lives to bl the door. In addition     to the PARTICIPANTS trying to g inside, they're holding    off Roger, Mr. Lo Biancho, Williamson and Hogan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quite disturbed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No entry without official credentials!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Emile Lo Biancho! I demand to be let in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NYPD!   Move aside! At the mention of POLICE, Roger's EYES GO WIDE. He slinks down, losing himself in the crowd and sidles off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chin set)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to see identification, officers. (to Mr. Lo Biancho)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Mr. Lo Biancho. Go right in. AT THE CORNER, Parker and Warren keep their distance, not wanting to be seen by the Detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she made it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's faster than she looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is -- but now she's not running to catch a policeman, but to try to keep from being over-taken by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the CROWD and the BARKING of the PACK draw the attention of everyone in the Lo Bianchos' box. MORTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that The Emperor, ma'am? MRS. LO BIANCHO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God.   He's mauve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew makes it across the floor and out the other side into a tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... appearing in the concession area.

dialogues.speaker: A SHIH-TZU
dialogues.text: as it breaks off, jumps onto a concession stand and begins looting it. Drew makes for the EXIT past the TICKET TAKERS who leap out of the way and just as she reaches the door and pushes it open...

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN OF DOGS
dialogues.text: Williamson, Hogan, Morty, Bruce, Mr. and Mrs. Lo Biancho and quite a few SPECTATORS pour out the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!  I'll get hives! (resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detectives appear above her.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She holds up The Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, just wanted to return him. As the other OWNERS and HANDLERS gather their dogs, Williamson hands The Emperor off to Mrs. Lo Biancho while Hogan handcuffs Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flog her! Step aside and I'll whip her myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you say it was a man who called, Dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she had an accomplice! We'll beat the information out of the little wench! (handing him The Emperor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him cleaned up, Emile. Williamson and Hogan move Drew toward their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't take her dog, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll sort it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have this interview. I mean, it's not really an interview. I'd never lie to the police... (it's over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... never mind. Just as they push her head down into the car, she glimpses a vaguely familiar face among the myriad GAWKERS -- it's the Bike Messenger. For just an instant they lock eyes before the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Parker and Warren round the corner at a run, only in time to watch the Detective's car leave with Drew in the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go to the jail and tell them what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth did happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Drew. She wanted to get into that program more than anything in the world. With a SIGH, they turn to go and BUMP -- knock into Bennie, who's staring coldly down at Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You goin' somewhere? She's paralyzed with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!   Please don't kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know anything at all! We didn't see anything or hear anything and I'll swear to that in a court of law! Bennie appears unmoved. Parker closes her eyes, trying to meet death with dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just not in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big idea? You two a couple a nutbags or somethin'? She opens one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nut bags? No. I mean,    yes. Is there a right answer to  that? See, my sister had this  interview which turned out not to  be an interview, really and I  sort of messed things up because  I wanted to meet him. Indicating Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   You came into town just for me?   Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Warren. (back to Bennie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew was going to be late even though technically she wasn't going to be late since there wasn't an interview and that's when we got in your car. I promise we meant to pay. It was a true emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant, why you runnin' when I'm trying to give you your bag back? Bennie hands Parker Drew's daybag.      Parker takes it, still trying to comprehend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found your mom's number in the book. She said you needed it pretty badly for that big interview. Listen, I gotta go. It's my mother-in-law's birthday and I gotta plant some stupid rose bush and then take her out to dinner at the Pier. See ya around. Bennie waddles over to his Town Car and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; calling after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he certainly is a good Samaritan. Parker looks at the daybag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys lead a pretty interesting life, don't you? But now Parker's mind is elsewhere.     She pulls out Dre daybook, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We going to the jail, or what? I've never been to a jail before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! A MUGS HOT is taken of Drew, looking as bedraggled, beaten and defeated as humanly possible.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: staring at her INK-STAINED FINGERS as Hogan finishes fingerprinting her other hand.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hands her a towel to wipe them off. We know that dirty hands would drive the old Drew crazy. This Drew merely tosses the towel into the garbage. Who gives a crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew sits among other FEMALE CRIMINALS, staring zombie- like. An INMATE with freaky frazzled red hair and a whacked out look in her eye sidles over to Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Bobo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (how in the world would this woman know?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, as a matter-of-fact, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a genius. OFF Drew's look of complete spiritual resignation we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren and Parker leap from a cab and hustle across campus. In only a few strides, Parker's dusting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to keep up, Warren!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I'm an intellectual! I never claimed to be athletic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact,  I was excused from P.E. because of  an ascended testicle! (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much information,   right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red points at Drew's one shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind?   I'm a fanatic for Jimmy Choo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours. She hands the high heel to Red, who enthusiastically pulls it on and models it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacLeod? Hogan ENTERS, opens the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're free to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I'll just stay here with the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eyewitness says he saw who took the dog. Didn't realize the guy was stealing it until he saw us grab you. Hogan takes her by the arm in a fatherly way and leads her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogan leads her into the lobby where Bike Messenger Guy is waiting. He stands up when he sees Drew. Her dissonance is even more confounded now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said. Go home. Get cleaned up, a good night's sleep. None of this will seem so bad in the morning. Hogan leaves them alone.       Bike Guy steps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? As an answer, Drew merely points to herself -- look at me? Now answer for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jim Wessler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jim.    How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could forget that face? Reminded, Drew puts a hand to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.    No hives. Suddenly, realizing just how awful she must look, Drew becomes self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... bye. She walks past him out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.    Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting me out of jail but I have to go home now because my entire life is ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad day, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turn understatement into an art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just tell me your name? Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Drew MacLeod. The girl who won't be going to the NYU Accelerated Program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Drew looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because short of flying, there's no way to get from here to NYU in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's on the stairs with Drew's DAYBOOK open, staring into it like someone who has a final exam in two minutes but forgot to show up for the semester. Warren's looking over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   And I thought I was anal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no good. I don't do too well with the whole rehearsal thing. I'm more of a 'wing it' person. Parker checks herself in her reflection in the glass. Working herself into Drew form, she puts her hair into a conservative bun and then tries straightening her posture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all business)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this look? Drewish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've always had a thing for librarians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren, honesty is fine. But you could edit a little, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish me luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: about to knock on a door that reads "Professor Que Spaulding, PhD" when the door suddenly opens and the last INTERVIEWEE steps out in a suit and tie, confidence oozing. Parker nods primly as he passes, then steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY sits at her computer.        She looks over h glasses at Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Professor Spaulding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no. However...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This is when the inner office door swings open and the PROFESSOR himself, coat over one arm, briefcase in the other, steps out. Parker positions herself directly in front of him, cutting off his EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Spaulding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have a moment of your time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I have a plane to catch. He tries to make a move.      Parker blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But this is very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life and death, if you must know. The Professor hesitates for just an instant, giving Parker her opening. She grabs his hand, giving it a vigorous, Young Republican shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Drew MacLeod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. MacLeod, I hope this is interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS leisurely make their way between classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!    Coming through!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Students dive out of the way as Jim comes barreling across campus with Drew clinging for life to his handlebars. Just outside the Administration Building, Jim hits the brakes and Drew FLIES OFF THE HANDLEBARS and like the puppy in the opening, disappears into a shrub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? The old Drew is back.     She scrambles out of the shrub...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. ... and up the stairs -- then stops, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait right there. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I don't want to be bossy. You don't have to stay right there, if you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. She launches herself into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker sits genteelly forward in her chair, legs crossed just so at the ankles, hands folded in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (primly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you, though my missing the deadline seems to suggest otherwise, my studies would never suffer on account of my being unorganized. This was, and I think anyone who knows me would vouch for this, a complete anomaly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so thrown when my sister asked Bernard to the dance that I simply failed to post the schedule request and seeing it already checked off on my to-do list, I over-looked it until after the deadline had passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. MacLeod, I recall your application being one of the strongest we received. Not seeing your name on the interview list surprised me. I assumed, of course, that you'd changed your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not at all. This program is my number one priority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, I'm sure you can appreciate that with so many applicants for so few spaces there must be rules to govern the selection process. A FUSS from the OUTER OFFICE interrupts them and suddenly the door bursts open and Drew BURSTS IN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Spaulding? I can't apologize enough for barging in like this. The Professor is not only thrown by the interruption, but by Drew's particularly bizarre, barefoot look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Please. It looks like I'm taking the red-eye now anyway. Drew shuts the door and then is startled when she gets a face full of Parker, already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried wink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (don't blow it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the Professor and I have had a wonderful talk about how important this program is to me and how it was my sister, Drew, who screwed things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a little trouble following this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were... being me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to sit down? Seeing her plan to help Drew go awry, poor Parker's lip trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saw them take you to jail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I didn't think you'd make it. I knew I wouldn't be any good at it, but I figured at least there was a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.    But let's talk about it later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.    Go right ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, consider, just for a moment, whether this is the appropriate time and place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I considered.     What I want to say is, I didn't    purposefully set out to ruin your    day, but that doesn't mean I'm not    a little... jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not like you. I don't have your intensity, your focus, your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fashion sense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just mean, maybe, even if I don't intend to, maybe that jealousy, you know, gets in the way sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean subliminally you're undermining me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I'd get that technical about it. But yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to confess now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confess what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be something. Like how you lost your shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you're secretly jealous of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I be jealous of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, let me see. Because I don't have a stick up my butt? Because I know how to have fun? Because I'm spontaneous and creative and men are all my love slaves? Drew stops, ponders this deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Then she smiles, only a teensy bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe about the love slaves. This is the first moment in a long time when the sisters share a smile. Drew turns to the Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, I'm Drew MacLeod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted more than anything in the world to be a part of your program. I still do. But I failed. I didn't follow the rules. And honestly, before today, I didn't know how I was going to live with that. How to live with failure. I'm not good at it. I haven't done it much. But today I realized that I've lived in fear of it too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope my application was a strong one and I came here today to ask your indulgence and to place my name back into consideration. If you won't, I'll understand. Better yet, I'll get over it. Maybe I shouldn't be in such a hurry after all. Maybe it would be best for me to just take this... Drew takes her DAYBOOK from Parker and drops it in the wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and lighten up. Parker looks horrified at the sight of Drew's daybook in the trash and fishes it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your time. Sorry if you missed your plane. He shakes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was worth it, I assure you. Now, could you clear up one thing for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren and Jim sit waiting when the Girls come out, smiling. Drew turns to Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. The sisters hug, but we GO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go. Parker grabs Warren by the hand and blasts around the corner just as... Charley MacLeod pulls up in his truck and parks half on, half off the curb. He leans over, waving to Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, baby! Drew goes over to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the city. I tried to call you. Thought you might want a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a new outfit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     Hey, one minute, 'kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Drew goes back to Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to maybe... get together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I want to take a shower. For about a week. Drew leans over and kisses him on the cheek.         Then reaches into her bag and pulls out a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a card? Aren't you in high school? She smiles, shrugs and climbs in her dad's truck. They pull away, leaving Jim waving. When they're out of sight, Parker and Warren come back around the corner of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. I'm doomed.     I'll never get home before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you will. Warren pulls out a CELL PHONE, hits speed dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?   Hey.   I need a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing over the City, Warren and Parker are strapped in, headphones on, and have to talk above the DIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren, something tells me you're spoiled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!   But in a good way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both girls are putting on makeup, getting ready to go out. Everything appears the same as before, Drew's side neat and clean, Parker's a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls? Quinn steps in, grimfaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How naive do you think I am? The Girls share a look.       Busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We, uh, don't think you're naive, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Honestly, it was all an accident. Quinn holds out her hand revealing a BELLY RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what this is. There's almost a palpable sense of relief between the girls. They BOTH LOOK DOWN and pull up their shirts -- Parker's not the only one who has her naval pierced -- Drew does, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I'm disappointed you'd do something like this without consulting me, but Drew? What got into you? Do you know how unhygienic those places are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was... spontaneous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Obviously. Oh, by the way... She holds out her other hand, which has an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This came in the mail. They stare at the envelope -- NYU ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?   Open it. There's a HONK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are here! Parker and Quinn stare at Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't really matter one way or the other. Maybe I shouldn't be in such a hurry. Why don't we go out and have some fun. Besides, if this isn't good news, I don't want it to ruin our night. Parker and Quinn simply continue to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MacLEOD LIVING ROOM - EVENING Charley's laying on the couch with some chips on his stomach watching the game. Jim and Warren are watching, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how'd you two meet the girls? Jim and Warren share a look.        This is a story best untold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dance/A class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dance class, huh? Stupid    me. I figured it had to be that   day in New York when Parker blew   off her chem test and Drew was in   jail. Charley smiles.       He's not as out of it as he appears Suddenly, all three women SCREAM JOYFULLY O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chips?
